metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15025 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
ntpd in ntp 4.2.8 before 4.2.8p15 and 4.3.x before 4.3.101 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by sendingpackets, because memory is not freed in situations where a CMAC key is usedand associated with a CMAC algorithm in the ntp.keys file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p15+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p15+dfsg-1ubuntu1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p15+dfsg-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntp package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p15+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
